description:
An Office 365 account could be used from Chrome, but I am happy to see this running as a desktop app on Linux.

A lot better for focus having separate launcher icons and systray integration, especially when having multiple work acounts to use at the same time.
summary: Happy to have this on Linux

description: actually pleasantly surprised by how well this works. tried a number of other options and so far this has the least problems. in fact, i have had no issues with it since the install and all alerts, integeration, and fucntionality are performing as expected.
summary: great app working just like the web version

description: I much prefer having my webapps as seperate desktop applications and I'm happy to have another replacement like that
works as you would expect, but it keeps logging me out which is really annoying. i have to log in and supply my auth code every time which makes me not want to use it.
summary: works but keeps logging me out

description: works much better than the native Outlook PWA. highly recommended...
I have tried 4 seperate Outlook clients, 2 from aur and 2 from discover and this is the only one that worked with my institutions specific two factor. Thanks!
I know that ads help developer generate revenue but it kind of annoying to me and thats the only con and also the one that I have to login everytime I open the application.
summary: Works great but the ads suck
